page.title: 01GENERAL DESCRIPTION OF AREA
page.content: The area is very rural being seven miles from the nearest small town, Bourne and twenty miles from the nearest city, Peterborough. The west of the area is part of the Kesteven Plateau, the land is gently sloping and is drained by two streams which flow down to the South Forty Foot drain, the main drain of this part of the fens. The Eastern part is fen margin. Most of the area was originally wooded but now all but the heaviest of land is cleared and used for arable farming. The two main villages in the area are Aslackby (pronounced Aselby) and Pointon. Farming is very mechanised and large quantities of artificial fertilisers and chemical sprays for pest and fungicides are used. Population in the area is slowly declining all the time.
